hanzi-su-wiki:
技

Значения

Дело, умение; мастерство, ловкость

Мнемоника

Умение жонглировать, перебрасывая из руки 扌 в руку палку 支.
purpleculture_pinyin:
jì
skill
навык
rtega_mnemonic:
技技RS伎skill, ability, talent, ingenuity
  • (person 亻) with hand 扌 supporting 支 skill and talent
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 支 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
技术 [ jì shù ]: technology; technique; skill; Classifiers: 门
科技 [ kē jì ]: science and technology
技能 [ jì néng ]: technical ability; skill
高科技 [ gāo kē jì ]: high tech; high technology
技巧 [ jì qiǎo ]: skill; technique
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 支 [ zhī ] to support, to sustain; to withdraw, to pay; a branch (of a bank)
heisig_chinese_memo: Your fingers grasp a branch so you can show off your fencing skills to your friends safely. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: skill, finger, fingers, branch, ten, needle, crotch
Keyword_KANJIDIC: skill, art, craft, ability, feat, performance, vocation, arts
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: мастерство, искусство, ремесло, умение, подвиг, производительность, призвание, искусство
koohiiStory1: (Adapted from darg_sama´s) Balancing a branch on your finger is the prototypical example of a skill that is nothing more than a skill (i.e., it is completely useless).
koohiiStory2: I think of a guy balancing a branch on his finger, which definitely takes some minimal amount of skill.
jp_example_words:
技能(ぎのう): technical skill, ability, capacity
特技(とくぎ): special skill
技(わざ): art, technique
演技(えんぎ): acting, performance
技師(ぎし): engineer, technician
競技(きょうぎ): game, match, contest
技術(ぎじゅつ): technique
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You can branch out your fingers. It's your special skill. Your fingers branch out into smaller fingers and you can hold things really well. You can type super-duper fast. And you can win any tickle fight. These are skills you have thanks to your branching fingers.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: If you could have any skill imaginable, what would it be? Would it be to have these magical branching fingers? (Definitely. It would.)
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Unfortunately, these skills are too much for the normal skill-less people to handle and they pull out the guillotine (ぎ). I guess they're going to chop off your skillful fingers because they're kinda scary.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a tiny guillotine made for the cutting of fingers. Whoever made this must have had special hand skills too! Maybe they tested it on him...
Ru_Meaning: skill, art, craft, ability, feat, performance, vocation, arts
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 伎 (わざ、ギ навык, Кабуки), 枝 (えだ、シ ветка)
Ru_Radicals: 十 (десять), 又 (опять), 扎, 支 (филиал)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: your hands (扌) support (支) you with techniques
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Your fingers grasp a branch so you can show off your fencing skills to your friends safely. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
" hand ", " support " sound, the original meaning is talent and skill. "Shuowen": "Qiao Ye. From the hand, support the sound." "Shu ‧ Qin Oath": "If there is a minister, there is no other skill, and the heart is rested, and it is as if it has tolerance.

" Technology " can mean craftsman. "Xunzi-Rich Country": "Therefore, a hundred skills are made, so you can raise one person." Yang Yan's note: "Technology, workmanship."

" Technology " refers to women who work in singing and dancing. The Southern Dynasties Liang Xiaotong's "Seven Deeds": "Leisure to be a talented child in the side of Long, Handan's skill."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " hand " and " support ", the original meaning is talent and skill.
humanum_full_description:
「手」，「支」聲，本義為才能、技巧。《說文》：「巧也。从手，支聲。」 《書‧秦誓》：「如有一介臣，斷斷猗無他技，其心休休焉，其如有容。」

　　「技」可表示工匠。《荀子‧富國》：「故百技所成，所以養一人也。」楊倞注：「技，工也。」

　　「技」指以歌舞為業的女人。南朝梁蕭統〈七契〉：「閒以邊隴才童，邯鄲妙技。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「支」聲，本義為才能、技巧。

「 手 」，「 支 」聲，本義為才能、技巧。《說文》：「巧也。从手，支聲。」 《書‧秦誓》：「如有一介臣，斷斷猗無他技，其心休休焉，其如有容。」 「 技 」可表示工匠。《荀子‧富國》：「故百技所成，所以養一人也。」楊倞注：「技，工也。」 「 技 」指以歌舞為業的女人。南朝梁蕭統〈七契〉：「閒以邊隴才童，邯鄲妙技。」
" hand", " support" sound, the original meaning is talent and skill. "Shuowen": "Qiao Ye. From the hand, support the sound." "Shu ‧ Qin Oath": "If there is a minister, there is no other skill, and the heart is rested, and it is as if it has tolerance. " Technology" can mean craftsman. "Xunzi-Rich Country": "Therefore, a hundred skills are made, so you can raise one person." Yang Yan's note: "Technology, workmanship." " Technology" refers to women who work in singing and dancing. The Southern Dynasties Liang Xiaotong's "Seven Deeds": "Leisure to be a talented child in the side of Long, Handan's skill."

技字的基本解释

技
jì
才能，手艺：技术。技巧。技艺。技能。技法。黔驴技穷。雕虫小技。

技字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jì］
［《廣韻》渠綺切，上紙，羣。］
(1)才能；技巧。
(2)工匠。
(3)歌舞。
(4)指以歌舞为业的女人。
(5)犹拟。揣度。
[②]［qí］
［《集韻》翹移切，平支，溪。］
不端。

技字的英文翻译

◎ 技
ability, skill, trick

技字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　技； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页420第02
【唐韻】渠綺切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】巨綺切，?奇上聲。【說文】巧也。【禮·王制】作奇技，奇器以疑衆。【疏】若公輸般請以機窆，指其人巧謂之奇技，指其機窆謂之奇器。【前漢·藝文志】技巧者，習手足，便器械，積機關，以立攻守之勝者也。　又【廣韻】藝也。又方術也。【禮·王制】凡執技以事上者，祝史射御醫卜及百工。又【坊記】尚技而賤車，則民興藝。　又能也。【書·秦誓】斷斷兮無他技。又【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?奇寄切，音芰。義同。　通作伎。

技字的源字形

技字的起名意思

：本义指技艺，技巧，才艺，引申为才能，本领的意思。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Ji] [Hand Character Department] 　 Skill; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 420 No. 02
[Tang Yun] Qu Qiqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun] Ju Qiqie, Qi Shangsheng. [Said Wen] Qiao Ye. 【Rite·Wang System】Making wonders, strange tools are suspicious of the crowd. 【Sparse】If you lose publicly, please use the machine to refer to the strange skill that the person cleverly called, and the strange tool to refer to the machine. 【Former Han·Art and Literature History】Skills, master hand, foot, handy equipment, accumulate organs, and win by standing offensive and defensive.　[Guang Yun] Yi Ye. It's also alchemy. 【Rite·Royal System】Whoever performs skills and works, Zhu Shishe, the imperial doctor, and Baigong. Also [Fang Ji] The people are prospering art if they are skilled and cheap.　I can do it again. [Book·Qin Oath] There is no other skill to break. Also 【Ji Yun】【Rhyme Meeting】【Zheng Yun】? Qi Ji cut, the sound is 芰. The same meaning.　Through tricks.

Source glyph
Skill
Name meaning
: The original meaning refers to skills, skills, talents, extended to the meaning of talent, ability.
形声字。手(キ)表意,表示手艺、技能;支(zhi)表声,支是竹的细枝,含有细致精巧之意。本义是技能、技巧。
技能;本领;手艺:~巧|~术「黔驴~穷。

技
约技技
楷
Пиктофонетические символы.
Рука (キ) выражает значение, что означает мастерство и умение; Чжи (zhi) выражает звук, который представляет собой веточку бамбука, что означает тонкий и нежный.
Первоначальное значение - навыки и умения.
Навыки; Навыки; Мастерство: ~ Цяо | ~ Навык "Цяньлу ~ бедный.
~ Fa ~ Работа ~ Beat ~ Can ~ Poor ~ Teacher ~ itch ~ Art

Сиань ~ Акт ~ Разное ~ ~ Лун Дяо Чун Сяо ~ Гуй Львов ~
Навык
Контрактная технология
Кай
jì
I сущ.
1) искусство, умение, навык, техника, мастерство; ловкость, сноровка; приём; искусный
绝技 величайшее мастерство, превосходная техника
口技 искусство звукоподражания
技穷 искусство истощилось, все приёмы оказались бессильными
2) талант; способности; талантливый, способный
无他技 не обладать никакими другими способностями
3)* ремесленник; мастер
故百技所成, 所以养一人也 поэтому сделанное всеми мастеровыми идёт для того, чтобы прокормить одного человека
II гл.
* угадывать, разгадывать
技其心 предугадать (разгадать) его намерения
Radicals: 扌, 支  (fingers, branch)
Meaning Mnemonic
You can branch out your fingers. It's your special skill. Your fingers branch out into smaller fingers and you can hold things really well. You can type super-duper fast. And you can win any tickle fight. These are skills you have thanks to your branching fingers.
If you could have any skill imaginable, what would it be? Would it be to have these magical branching fingers? (Definitely. It would.)
Reading Mnemonic
Unfortunately, these skills are too much for the normal skill-less people to handle and they pull out the guillotine (ぎ). I guess they're going to chop off your skillful fingers because they're kinda scary.
Imagine a tiny guillotine made for the cutting of fingers. Whoever made this must have had special hand skills too! Maybe they tested it on him...
